dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 5430 IH: Puerto Rico Real Estate Exchange Fairness Act of 2018
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Miss González-Colón of Puerto Rico (for herself and Mr. Soto) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to treat Puerto Rico as part of the United States for purposes of determining whether property qualifies for treatment as a like-kind exchange.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Puerto Rico Real Estate Exchange Fairness Act of 2018.

section.header: Puerto Rico treated as part of United States for purposes of determination of like-kind exchanges

subsection.text: Section 1031(h) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, the term United States shall be treated as including Puerto Rico.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to exchanges completed after the date of the enactment of this Act.
